screen_desc: The screenshot shows the search results page in a smartphone's app store. The search bar at the top is labeled "search for apps & games." Below it, there are three search results displayed: "google sheets," "yahoo mail," and "paramount+ peak streaming."
action_think: The search results page is visible, but the target app 'Firefox Browser' is not listed. Possible actions include scrolling further up the search results, or using the search bar to type in the app name directly.
action_plan: scroll up in the search results
use search bar to type in app name and search
action_result: By typing in the query "Firefox browser" into the search bar, you have successfully entered the term you want to search for. This action is a step towards finding the Firefox Browser app and opening it, which is your user request. Now, you will be able to search for the Firefox Browser app using the search results displayed on the screen.
prev_action_result: By clicking on the search icon, you have opened the search bar where you can enter your query. This action is a necessary step in finding the Firefox Browser app. You can now type in "Firefox Browser" into the search bar to locate and open the app.
